description.narrative: The Project has an Anticipated Impact Measurement & Monitoring (AIMM) rating of Good. The main expected project-level outcomes are the environmental impact by displacing GHG emissions each year and the stakeholder impact by helping address growing demand and expected electricity shortages in Vietnam. Beyond the Project, the investment is expected to increase market competitiveness by supporting much-needed private investment in the energy sector which has been dominated by state owned enterprises and demonstrating the role of wind power in the Vietnam's electricity generation mix.

Thuan Binh Wind Power Joint Stock Company (TBW or the Company; http://www.tbw.com.vn), founded in 2009 with the headquarter in Binh Thuan province, Vietnam, is one of the first wind power companies in Vietnam. It has developed and operated the Phu Lac 1 wind power project (24MW) in Binh Thuan province since September 2016. TBW is currently developing the Phu Lac 2 wind power project (26 MW) in Binh Thuan province and the Loi Hai 2 wind power project (28.9 MW) in Ninh Thuan province. International Finance Corporation (IFC) - the private sector arm of the World Bank Group - is considering a senior, secured corporate loan to TBW to finance the development and construction of the Phu Lac 2 and Loi Hai 2 projects (the Project).

name.narrative: The Phu Lac 2 project is located in Tuy Phong District, Binh Thuan province, and the Loi Hai 2 project is located in Thuan Bac District, Ninh Thuan province, both in Vietnam.
